tweets.html:
I feel like a great dad when my kids watch PBS for 6 hours.

— Mike Leffingwell (@mikeleffingwell) April 1, 2012

God damn it, #TheKilling is on tonight.

— tv observatory (@tvobservatory) April 1, 2012

It literally almost can't get much worse for NBC: Last night's Ford-bought Escape Routes did a 0.2/1 in 18-49. We are near hash tags, people

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) April 1, 2012

@TVMoJoe #endtimes

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) April 1, 2012

I can't believe @alan_tudyk did an April Fool joke about Firefly coming back. Dude. Too soon.

— Nathan Fillion (@NathanFillion) April 1, 2012

oh antiques roadshow shove it all in the skip. IN THE BLOODY SKIP. then LANDFILL IT.

— Grace Dent (@gracedent) April 1, 2012

The Killing is actually going to have a well-told story tonight. #AprilFools

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) April 1, 2012

I will block anybody who tweets that #Community has been renewed followed by #AprilFools. Try me! Upfronts are close and I'm on edge.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) April 1, 2012

Enjoying Titanic: "What if we're hit by an iceberg?" "This ship is the most modern technology available. It can take anything." etc. etc.

— Chris Addison (@mrchrisaddison) April 1, 2012

"What if it's a really big iceberg?" "In April? They're melting by then. God damn it, man, I want this ship finished on time." #titanic

— Chris Addison (@mrchrisaddison) April 1, 2012

"This ship is really big. Should it be this big?" "God damn it, man, I want this ship finished on time." #tifuckingtanic

— Chris Addison (@mrchrisaddison) April 1, 2012

"Now remember: when setting table in the First Class dining room, do it the same way you've seen them do it on Downton." #tipissingtanic

— Chris Addison (@mrchrisaddison) April 1, 2012

"The captain would like to invite you to dine at his table this evening. It's the one nearest the weakest point in the wall." #tiredtanic

— Chris Addison (@mrchrisaddison) April 1, 2012

"Working class people! Pay attention! To swim, flap your arms as though you were scaling the inside of a wide chimney." #tiiiiiiitanic

— Chris Addison (@mrchrisaddison) April 1, 2012

"Posh people this lifeboat, working class women who've been given the glad eye by a man with brass buttons, this lifeboat."

— Chris Addison (@mrchrisaddison) April 1, 2012

"Look! Water! On my legs!" *Cuts to black. End credits.*

— Chris Addison (@mrchrisaddison) April 1, 2012

Next time on Titanic: Have a fucking guess.

— Chris Addison (@mrchrisaddison) April 1, 2012

Never show me the insanely violent and disturbing Japanese thing the sanitized American one is based on, please

— Mindy Kaling (@mindykaling) April 1, 2012

If you're thinking up and Tweeting one-liners about a film or TV show every few minutes, you're not really watching. You're riffing.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) April 1, 2012

@mattzollerseitz I dunno. I often watch TV while taking notes on said TV. Am I really watching?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 1, 2012

@HitFixDaniel Is every note a cleverly phrased open mic night laff line? If so, yes. If not, no. You're taking notes.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) April 1, 2012

@mattzollerseitz Can't help it if I'm hilarious. My notes are like watching "Vampire Diaries" at the Algonquin Round Table.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 2, 2012

@HitFixDaniel @mattzollerseitz If Ian Somerhalder were laid end to end, I wouldn't be surprised.

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) April 2, 2012

I watched wrestling in middle school and all these guys are STILL GOING. I love the Undertaker, y'all. #WrestleMania

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) April 2, 2012

The amount of people live tweeting Wrestlemania on my Twitter feed right now is making me seriously reconsider some of my life choices.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) April 1, 2012

This is the best #WrestleMania since Jacob fought the angel!

— God (@TheTweetOfGod) April 2, 2012

April Fools, everybody! Wrestlemania's fake!!!

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) April 2, 2012

"I wish Olivia Munn would come back to do more work as a correspondent for #TheDailyShow" - no one

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) April 2, 2012

Oooh, they're going "further east than they've ever gone before" in #gameofthrones. Might there be ASIANS in this season?

— Kevin Li (@kevinlig) April 2, 2012

#SixSeasonsandaMediator

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) April 2, 2012

More often than not, reading Twitter is like hearing someone else watch TV.

— edgarwright (@edgarwright) April 2, 2012

Hahaha, I think someone just put an ad for Internet explorer on the tv! Good April fools!

— Willa Paskin (@willapaskin) April 2, 2012

tweets.html:
more #BobsBurgers montage songs, less everything else.

— rich (who is, in many ways, poor) (@p00rrichard) April 2, 2012

No, actually, the idea that there's an "academy" of country music is the best April fools joke of 2012. Good job, CBS!

— reject fascism (@charredlarvae) April 2, 2012

Academy of Country Music Awards make the #NFL's pandering to the god/military/guns/Amurrrica bumpkins seem amateurish. This is pro stuff.

— Dan Bernstein (@dan_bernstein) April 2, 2012

Remember these three if you win Academy of Country Music award: (1) Jesus; (2) Country radio; (3) Troops.

— Ross McKeen (@mightytoycannon) April 2, 2012

Wow check out this residual check I got in the mail yesterday! Showbiz is awesome! pic.twitter.com/3zYrFePL

— Scott Chernoff (@ScottChernoff) April 2, 2012

tweets.html:
well. he's definitely going full Sorkin. #TheNewsroom

— rich (who is, in many ways, poor) (@p00rrichard) April 2, 2012

Sorkin's THE NEWSROOM looks like STUDIO 60 if it had been shot 10 years after everyone stopped watching SNL. So, STUDIO 62

— Julie Bush (@julie_bush) April 2, 2012

Obligatory "#TheNewsroom looks awesome except for Olivia Munn" tweet. Because she is the worst. #brokenrecord #ireallyhateher

— Tim (@rural_juror) April 2, 2012

KBC (my fake TV network while you were all playing D&D) had a show called #Newsroom on in the late 80s. It won all the #Emmys.

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 2, 2012

I guess some people think of Aaron Sorkin the way I think of Joss Whedon. Only way I can really understand it.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) April 2, 2012

Ah, Aaron Sorkin. Come closer to me. Tell me things I already know in rapid patter fashion. Make me feel better than people not watching you

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) April 2, 2012

It is almost unbelievable how much that Aaron Sorkin trailer sounds like everything he's already written thrown in a blender.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 2, 2012

Fine, I'll play along. I'll pretend all of you snarking on Sorkin won't watch THE NEWSROOM this summer.

— inessentials (@inessentials) April 2, 2012

Wish The Killing had stuck with its original title, America's Worst Police Department.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) April 2, 2012

tweets.html:
Please, everyone who is watching The Killing, livetweet it. With spoilers, please. I want to see/feel your pain.

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) April 1, 2012

Revealed tonight: Ser Ilyn Payne killed Rosie Larsen outside Baelor's Sept. #GameofKilling

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) April 1, 2012

Note to #TheKilling: adding pounding, crescendoing drums will not bring back the thriller tension you squandered last season. #Magicisgone

— Ellen O'Neill (@MaPeel) April 2, 2012

If #TheKilling was run like #TVD that entire season would have fit into the first 15 minutes of episode one.

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) April 2, 2012

If she'd get that damn kid settled & stop popping in that nicotine gum, I could concentrate on being mad about mystery. #TheKilling

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 2, 2012

The only way Stan Larsen's oldest son could seem more Canadian would be if he was wearing a "Let's Go to the Mall" shirt.

Alright, I didn't see that coming. #TheKilling

— (((Andrew Rabin))) (@arrabin56) April 2, 2012

Today at Target I was tempted to buy post-its and add a "Don't buy this; you don't find out" note to every copy of #TheKilling S1 DVDs.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 2, 2012

That was a fine hour of television. Not extraordinary. Not horrendous. Fine. #TheKilling (Let's see if @TheKilling_AMC RTs this one)

— (((Andrew Rabin))) (@arrabin56) April 2, 2012

It's nice to see Holder & Sulky again. #TheKilling

Oooh, they're going "further east than they've ever gone before" in #gameofthrones. Might there be ASIANS in this season?

— Kevin Li (@kevinlig) April 2, 2012

Wish The Killing had stuck with its original title, America's Worst Police Department.

Note to #TheKilling: adding pounding, crescendoing drums will not bring back the thriller tension you squandered last season. #Magicisgone

I know it's chilly in Seattle & girlfriend doesn't really have a home there, but Linden's sweaters are so stinky yard sale. #TheKilling

— Jo Garfein (@jopinionated) April 2, 2012

If you live-tweet spoilers from a TV show as it happens, you should get your Twitter privileges revoked.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) April 2, 2012

Game of Moans: Technical Achievements in Graphic Sexual Foley Artistry on HBOs Hit Series #GameOfThrones #TheNorthRemembers

— The Journal of BS (@AcademicTitles) April 2, 2012

Could someone fetch me a direwolf puppy, please? I'm pretty sure it's the only way to cure my headche.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) April 1, 2012

Not really up on the whole thing but I hope whichever team you're cheering for wins the most thrones tonight.

— John Moe (@johnmoe) April 1, 2012

"This show is pretty fantastic. Great acting and writing, wonderful story and the--HOLY SHIT, DRAGONS, BAD ASS." #GoT

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 2, 2012

#GOT time. Dragons, direwolves and dwarves oh my.

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) April 2, 2012

Stop live tweeting TV shows.

— Andy Keil (@alwaysunday) April 2, 2012

There's at least one person wondering why all of Twitter is watching #GameOfThrones instead of #TheKilling. And that person is Veena Sud.

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) April 2, 2012

I remember nothing from the first season of 'Game Of Thrones'. I think someone died and somebody had sex while talking about dragons. #GOT

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) April 2, 2012

If I've learned anything watching #GoT, it's that I was pronouncing EVERYONE'S name wrong in my head when reading the books.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 2, 2012

I just call everyone in #GOT "Larry." Makes it much easier.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 2, 2012

Dragons are cool but direwolves own my heart. #thenorthremembers #Got

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) April 2, 2012

Well damn. They went there. #GoT

— Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison (@austindotTV) April 2, 2012

Is there a cooler credit to have in the business right now than "Wolf Unit"? #GOT

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) April 2, 2012

Game of Torrent.

Waiting nearly 50 minutes into the season before the first superfluous boobs counts as downright Calvinist restraint for this show. #GOT

#GOT crew member at bar: "Me? I work on the Wolf Unit." Everyone else at bar: *sleeps with crew member immediately.*

My main reaction to #GameofThrones: I'm glad that I decided to read the book. Otherwise I would have been lost.

Bran really needs to get Leslie Knope to run the meetings at Winterfell. #GameOfThrones

DIREWOLVES. That is all. #GOT

Baby polar bears ZOMG!!! #FrozenPlanet

Sorry, GAME OF THRONES. #seriouslyholyshit

Emmy Rossum NEEDS an Emmy nomination. This is not up for debate. She is phenomenal. #Shameless

...I DID NOT SEE THAT COMING. #Shameless

Now that GAME OF THRONES and MAD MEN are on the same night, some enterprising bartender needs to invent a mead-and-scotch cocktail.

I am deeply flattered when people refer to me as an ugly Jon Hamm.

I didn't mind 2 hours with no Betty. I hate 15 minutes without Joan. #MadMen

— (((Andrew Rabin))) (@arrabin56) April 2, 2012

Oh shit, she's got like three chins. They destroyed the only thing Betty had. This is delightful. #madmen

"NOPE." Laughing forever. #MadMen

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 2, 2012

I know there are extenuating circumstances, but Matthew Weiner really does hate Betty Draper, doesn't he? #MadMen

Buck up, January Jones! If Lee Adama taught us anything, it's that light to moderate jumproping can erase sudden TV weight gain. #MadMen

— Caroline Framke (@carolineframke) April 2, 2012

At the end of tonight's #MadMen, I'm hoping there'll be a message "April Fools! Now here's the real episode" #TooMuchBetty

Everything about Betty Draper is the worst.#MadMen

— robert kessler (@thebobkessler) April 2, 2012

Spoiler Alert- This week's #MadMen takes place in the same year as last week's.

It is about time #MadMen made a Bewitched joke.

Aaaand Betty Draper, er, Francis remains the 60's worst mother of the decade. #madmen

January Jones' fat suit is heinous. This type of punishment usually reserved for Dianna Agron on #glee. #MadMen

I really hope whenever #MadMen ends, Matt Weiner writes a sitcom.

I miss Joan. When do we get Joan back? #MadMen

Betty Klump. #MadMen

"NEXT WEEK ON #MADMEN" PEOPLE SAY WORDS THAT MEAN ABSOLUTELY NOTHING WITHOUT PROPER CONTEXT

Sad Betty Draper needs a diversion. Someone give her a Pinterest invite.

Also, when did Harry stop wearing bow ties? Doesn't he know bow ties are cool? #MadMen
